conclusion: We have a particle moving along two semi-circular arcs, each with a radius of 1 meter, from point A to point C, taking 5 seconds. We need to find the average velocity and the average speed.
There are two semi-circular arcs, each with a radius of 1 meter.
A full circle with radius 1 meter has a circumference of 2π meters. Each semi-circle has a length of π meters.
The total path the particle travels is 2π meters.
The particle is moving along two connected semi-circles, possibly forming a circular path with a total circumference of 2π, starting at A and ending at C.
Points A, B, and C are on a straight line, with point B somewhere in between.
Average speed is total distance traveled divided by the total time taken: v_avg = 2π/5 meters per second.
Average velocity is displacement divided by time. Displacement is the straight-line distance from A to C.
